global_param.name: CUSTOM_FONT_SIZE
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Title Font Size]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Font sized used for the title in the start up screen]

global_param.name: CUSTOM_ICON
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Custom Icon]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[URI to a custom image to be used as start up logo]

global_param.name: CUSTOM_ICON_WIDTH
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Icon Width]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Width of the custom image (by default 35px)]

global_param.name: CUSTOM_ICON_HEIGHT
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Icon Height]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Height of the custom icon (with the px mention)]

global_param.name: CUSTOM_ICON_ONLY
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Icon Only]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Skip the title, only display an image]

global_param.name: CUSTOM_WELCOME_MESSAGE
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Welcome Message]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[An additionnal message displayed in the start up screen]

global_param.name: CLIENT_TIMEOUT_TIME
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Client Timeout]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[The length of the client session in SECONDS. By default, it's copying the server session length. In most PHP installation, it will be 1440, ie 24minutes. You can set this value to 0, this will make the client session 'infinite' by pinging the server at regular occasions (thus keeping the PHP session alive). This is not a recommanded setting for evident security reasons.]

global_param.name: CLIENT_TIMEOUT_WARN
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Warning Before]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Number of MINUTES before the session expiration for issuing an alert to the user]
